<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Ghost Charge](/Equipment.aspx?ID=687)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Bomb" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=21" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Positive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=128" />
<trait label="Splash" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=150" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 253 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Strike</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These spring-loaded metal canisters contain a mixture of chemicals and salts that drain and disintegrate nearby [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creatures. A ghost charge deals the listed positive damage and splash damage, though as usual for positive damage, this damage harms only undead and creatures with [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42). Ghost charges are designed to explode even on contact with a spiritual substance, making them ideal for damaging [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) undead. A primary target that takes damage from a ghost charge becomes [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

level="2"

>
Ghost Charge (Lesser)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 253 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Price** 3 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The bomb deals 1d8 positive damage and 1 positive splash damage, and the target is enfeebled 1 until the start of your next turn.

>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 2d8 positive damage and 2 positive splash damage, and the target is enfeebled 1 until the start of your next turn.
